Comments_List: This class changed my entire perspective on environmental ethics. I was interested in religion and ecology before coming to FES. Professor Grim and Tucker solidified that interest. I gained a strong theoretical background to many concepts that have been brewing in my mind for a while.
How religious leaders are or can get involved in raising awareness on climate change and environmental issues
Overall understanding of religion and ecology, especially western traditions.
A basic understanding of religious cosmologies and their relationships to ecology, nature, and environmental history.

I learned very much. The readings were interesting and provided a wide perspective. Before taking the course, I feared that it would be too focused on western religions. Also, that it would require to be religious. However, I felt comfortable with the material on Canvas, not being a particularly religious person.
Beautiful text and insights. Lectures were fruitful and rich.
Broader perspective
It aligned very well, even more so, I would say. I expected lots of reading and minimal discussion - it was quite the opposite.
It expounded my knowledge of different religion around the world in relation to their belief with Nature
More than my expectations.
I learned a lot more than I was expecting to.
They were better than I expected.
Directly inline. Presented well.
Very well

Strengths - discussion environment was the most comfortable I have ever experienced in a course. 

Weaknesses - online discussion isn't as engaging as I had hoped for.
Enables discussion of various religions and science in environmental issues and climate change
The hybrid class is effective and efficient.
I liked the structure of the online supplements, it was useful in contextualizing class discussions.
Good material on Canvas. Writing a longer paper on a chosen topic could promote more reflection.
Beautiful course that opens you to thinking in new ways about the power of religion as a creating force for environmental conservation and flourishing.

I would recommend them to take the course because it addresses topics that are important to current issues of climate change and religion involvement in raising awareness and addressing climate change
It can be a fundamental course for all students who care about both human beings and nature.
Keep up on the readings, and put the time in outside of class.
The book is very good. Have an open perspective.
If it's of your interest - absolutely take it!
Including more examples of practical applications of course material would be great
